mods.abstract: New York monument located on Lookout Mountain at Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park. The monument consists of a large Roman Doric Column on a colonnade with a statue located at the top.

The Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park, the first and largest military park in the United States, is located at the Civil War battle sites for the Battle of Chickamauga and the Siege of Chattanooga. The park was established in 1890 to preserve the sites of military maneuvers and to also hold monuments and memorials to military organizations as well as states whose troops participated in fights at the location. The formal dedication of the park took place in 1895. The New York monument is the largest monument at the park and was completed in 1910.

subject.geographic: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)
